transportAdvice: Dakar has a network of local minibuses and shared taxis that cover most areas of the city, though they can be crowded and confusing for first-time visitors. Taxis are widely available and relatively affordable, while walking is practical in compact neighborhoods like the Plateau but less so across the sprawling city.

weather.description: Cool and dry with pleasant breezes, one of the most comfortable months to visit.
Dry and sunny with mild temperatures, excellent conditions for sightseeing.
Warm and dry, still comfortable before the heat of late spring builds.
Temperatures begin to rise noticeably, remaining mostly dry and sunny.
Hot and hazy with occasional harmattan dust, very little rainfall expected.
The rainy season begins to approach, bringing increased humidity and occasional showers.
Peak rainy season with frequent heavy downpours, often in the afternoon or evening.
The wettest month of the year with high humidity and regular rainfall, travel can be disrupted.
Still firmly in the rainy season with heavy showers and oppressive humidity.
Rains begin to taper off but humidity remains high and temperatures peak.
The dry season returns with cooling temperatures and much more comfortable conditions.
Cool, dry, and sunny â€” a popular time to visit as the harmattan brings fresh northerly winds.
